basics.name: Long Pan
basics.label: Frontend Developer
basics.summary: I am a web developer having expertise in frontend development and exposure to back- end development. I design and develop web applications using the latest technologies to deliver the product with quality code.

work.name: SHANGHAI FRIENDESS ELECTRONICS TECHNOLOGY.
highlights: Cloudnest. Contributed to the development of a web-based nesting software for plate laser cutting systems, where I implemented key features such as Report Generation, Label Printing, and Rule Identification. I designed and built the Report generation feature, enabling users to generate over 500 customized PDF and Excel reports using various editing tools. This resulted in a 30% increase in user productivity. I also developed the Label Printing feature, which streamlined production by allowing manufacturers to quickly print labels for each part of the nesting result.

MetalVerse. Played a critical role in the development of an automatic 3D model and CAD drawing generation system used for kitchen production. I developed key features such as Cabinet Generation, Board Hole Digging, and House Type Generation using Babylon.js and my knowledge of graphics and JavaScript to ensure the system was user-friendly and efficient.

WebCAD. Designed and implemented the UI and some of the shape drawing functions for this webbased CAD software. As a key member of the development team, I leveraged my expertise in graphics and UX design to improve user satisfaction scores by 15% and reduced user support requests by 30%.

Material Calculation System. Led the UI design, front-end, and back-end development of this project, which involved sending data from the user's ERP system to the server to calculate layout results. I used Vue2.0 and Element-UI for the front-end and Flask and Celery for the back-end, significantly reduced production time, resulting in a 40% decrease in project delivery timelines and a cost reduction of €50,000 annually.
work.summary:
* Cloudnest. Contributed to the development of a web-based nesting software for plate laser cutting systems, where I implemented key features such as Report Generation, Label Printing, and Rule Identification. I designed and built the Report generation feature, enabling users to generate over 500 customized PDF and Excel reports using various editing tools. This resulted in a 30% increase in user productivity. I also developed the Label Printing feature, which streamlined production by allowing manufacturers to quickly print labels for each part of the nesting result.
* MetalVerse. Played a critical role in the development of an automatic 3D model and CAD drawing generation system used for kitchen production. I developed key features such as Cabinet Generation, Board Hole Digging, and House Type Generation using Babylon.js and my knowledge of graphics and JavaScript to ensure the system was user-friendly and efficient.
* WebCAD. Designed and implemented the UI and some of the shape drawing functions for this webbased CAD software. As a key member of the development team, I leveraged my expertise in graphics and UX design to improve user satisfaction scores by 15% and reduced user support requests by 30%.
* Material Calculation System. Led the UI design, front-end, and back-end development of this project, which involved sending data from the user's ERP system to the server to calculate layout results. I used Vue2.0 and Element-UI for the front-end and Flask and Celery for the back-end, significantly reduced production time, resulting in a 40% decrease in project delivery timelines and a cost reduction of €50,000 annually.

work.name: TUQI CONSTRUCTION TECHONOLOGY.
highlights: Data Collection System. Automated the verification, collection, and cleaning of offline data, saving it to the enterprise data center, and supporting data submission to other systems. Utilized Node.js, jQuery, and LayUI in development. Employed libraries such as Excel.js and Ztree.js, and stored data in a MySQL database. Key contributions include developing batch row and cell merging, dictionary key-value copy features, and identifying data dictionaries in Excel files and displaying them in the form of a directory tree.

Three-dimensional Monitoring WEB Program for Trailing Suction Dredger Construction. Developed a 3D display page of the trailing suction dredger in the DTPM system that could display the real-time state of the dredger and its environment in three dimensions on the web. Used the React framework, along with WebGL and Three.js, for development. Responsible for obtaining real-time data such as hull attitude, displacement, and rake arm angle from the server and modifying the seabed terrain in real-time based on real point cloud data and the position of the rake head to simulate dredging effects through three-dimensional display.
work.summary:
* Data Collection System. Automated the verification, collection, and cleaning of offline data, saving it to the enterprise data center, and supporting data submission to other systems. Utilized Node.js, jQuery, and LayUI in development. Employed libraries such as Excel.js and Ztree.js, and stored data in a MySQL database. Key contributions include developing batch row and cell merging, dictionary key-value copy features, and identifying data dictionaries in Excel files and displaying them in the form of a directory tree.
* Three-dimensional Monitoring WEB Program for Trailing Suction Dredger Construction. Developed a 3D display page of the trailing suction dredger in the DTPM system that could display the real-time state of the dredger and its environment in three dimensions on the web. Used the React framework, along with WebGL and Three.js, for development. Responsible for obtaining real-time data such as hull attitude, displacement, and rake arm angle from the server and modifying the seabed terrain in real-time based on real point cloud data and the position of the rake head to simulate dredging effects through three-dimensional display.

work.name: Jinhua Toast Network Technology.
work.position: Graphic designer, UI designer | Front-end engineer
highlights: Independently designed and developed a registration page for the 3rd All-in-One Card Contest, which attracted over 200 participants and received about 5,000 visits. Implemented the lost and found function using Adobe Xd and the Vue framework in combination with Element-UI.
Improved the college schedule app Custed by adding four new features and resolving over 20 issues. Contributed to approximately 15,000 lines of code.
Designed 13 posters, 15 banner images, 2 group portraits, and 1 logo for the studio. Proud of how they effectively promoted the studio's events and activities.
work.summary:
* Independently designed and developed a registration page for the 3rd All-in-One Card Contest, which attracted over 200 participants and received about 5,000 visits. Implemented the lost and found function using Adobe Xd and the Vue framework in combination with Element-UI.
* Improved the college schedule app Custed by adding four new features and resolving over 20 issues. Contributed to approximately 15,000 lines of code.
* Designed 13 posters, 15 banner images, 2 group portraits, and 1 logo for the studio. Proud of how they effectively promoted the studio's events and activities.
